summary.content:
Today's selection covers 93 articles from 8 trusted sources, including 57 on Artificial Intelligence and 27 on Fraud/Cybersecurity.

• **AI Spotlight**: Tumbler Ridge suspect's ChatGPT account banned before shooting
• **Companies in Focus**: Coverage includes developments from OpenAI, Google, Anthropic
• **Security Alert**: CISA: BeyondTrust RCE flaw now exploited in ransomware attacks
• **Threat Landscape**: Today's coverage highlights ransomware, phishing, data breaches
• **Source Diversity**: Articles sourced from BBC Technology, The Verge, BleepingComputer, TechCrunch, NY Times Tech and others
• **Fresh Content**: 27 articles published in the last 24 hours

top.title: Tumbler Ridge suspect's ChatGPT account banned before shooting
top.description: OpenAI said the account's activity did not meet the threshold to flag it to authorities when it was identified.

top.title: Suspect in Tumbler Ridge school shooting described violent scenarios to ChatGPT
top.description: The suspect in the mass shooting at Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia, Jesse Van Rootselaar, was raising alarms among employees at OpenAI months before the shooting took place. This past June, Jesse had...

top.title: Amazon: AI-assisted hacker breached 600 FortiGate firewalls in 5 weeks
top.description: Amazon is warning that a Russian-speaking hacker used multiple generative AI services as part of a campaign that breached more than 600 FortiGate firewalls across 55 countries in five weeks. [...]

top.title: Google VP warns that two types of AI startups may not survive
top.description: As generative AI evolves, a Google VP warns that LLM wrappers and AI aggregators face mounting pressure, with shrinking margins and limited differentiation threatening their long-term viability.

top.title: OpenAI debated calling police about suspected Canadian shooter’s chats
top.description: Jesse Van Rootselaar's descriptions of gun violence were flagged by tools that monitor ChatGPT for misuse.

top.title: OpenAI’s first ChatGPT gadget could be a smart speaker with a camera
top.description: OpenAI's first hardware release will be a smart speaker with a camera that will probably cost between $200 and $300, according to The Information. The device will be able to recognize things like "ite...

more.title: CISA: BeyondTrust RCE flaw now exploited in ransomware attacks
more.description: Hackers are actively exploiting the CVE-2026-1731 vulnerability in the BeyondTrust Remote Support product, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) warns. [...]

more.title: Anthropic-funded group backs candidate attacked by rival AI super PAC
more.description: Dueling pro-AI PACs have centered around backing or targeting one New York congressional bid: Alex Bores, whose RAISE Act requires AI developers to disclose safety protocols and report serious system...

more.title: The Pentagon vs. Anthropic + An A.I. Agent Slandered Me + Hot Mess Express
more.description: This would be an unprecedented escalation against a U.S. company.

more.title: ‘Starkiller’ Phishing Service Proxies Real Login Pages, MFA
more.description: Most phishing websites are little more than static copies of login pages for popular online destinations, and they are often quickly taken down by anti-abuse activists and security firms. But a stealt...

more.title: The Pitt has a sharp take on AI
more.description: Each episode of HBO's The Pitt features some degree of medical trauma that almost makes the hospital drama feel like a horror series. Some patients are dealing with gnarly lacerations while others are...

more.title: The AI security nightmare is here and it looks suspiciously like lobster
more.description: A hacker tricked a popular AI coding tool into installing OpenClaw - the viral, open-source AI agent OpenClaw that "actually does things" - absolutely everywhere. Funny as a stunt, but a sign of what...

more.title: PromptSpy is the first known Android malware to use generative AI at runtime
more.description: Researchers have discovered the first known Android malware to use generative AI in its execution flow, using Google's Gemini model to adapt its persistence across different devices. [...]

more.title: OpenAI says 18- to 24-year-olds account for nearly 50% of ChatGPT usage in India
more.description: The company said on Friday that users between 18 and 24 years of age account for nearly 50% of all messages sent by Indians to ChatGPT, and users under 30 account for 80% of usage in the country.

more.title: Google’s new Gemini Pro model has record benchmark scores — again
more.description: Gemini 3.1 Pro promises a Google LLM capable of handling more complex forms of work.

more.title: PromptSpy Android Malware Abuses Gemini AI at Runtime for Persistence
more.description:
The malware leverages Gemini to analyze on-screen elements and ensure that it remains on the device even after a reboot.
The post PromptSpy Android Malware Abuses Gemini AI at Runtime for Persistence...

more.title: Data breach at French bank registry impacts 1.2 million accounts
more.description: The French Ministry of Finance has published an announcement informing of a cybersecurity incident that has impacted 1.2 million accounts. [...]

more.title: Why fake AI videos of UK urban decline are taking over social media
more.description: Deepfakes showing grim taxpayer-funded waterparks have gone viral and drawn some racist responses.

more.title: People Loved the Dot-Com Boom. The A.I. Boom, Not So Much.
more.description: Tech leaders are beginning to worry about the public’s underwhelming enthusiasm for their plans to remake the world with artificial intelligence. Will that burst the bubble?

more.title: Nvidia deepens early-stage push into India’s AI startup ecosystem
more.description: Nvidia is working with investors, nonprofits, and venture firms to build earlier ties with India's fast-growing AI founder ecosystem.

more.title: BeyondTrust Vulnerability Exploited in Ransomware Attacks
more.description:
CISA has updated its KEV entry for CVE-2026-1731 to alert organizations of exploitation in ransomware attacks.
The post BeyondTrust Vulnerability Exploited in Ransomware Attacks appeared first on Secu...

more.title: 'God-Like' Attack Machines: AI Agents Ignore Security Policies
more.description: Microsoft Copilot recently summarized and leaked user emails; but any AI agent will go above and beyond to complete assigned tasks, even breaking through their carefully designed guardrails.

more.title: Lessons From AI Hacking: Every Model, Every Layer Is Risky
more.description: After two years of finding flaws in AI infrastructure, two Wiz researchers advise security pros to worry less about prompt injection and more about vulnerabilities.

more.title: Critical Grandstream Phone Vulnerability Exposes Calls to Interception
more.description:
The flaw tracked as CVE-2026-2329 can be exploited without authentication for remote code execution with root privileges. 
The post Critical Grandstream Phone Vulnerability Exposes Calls to Intercepti...

more.title: Trump is making coal plants even dirtier as AI demands more energy
more.description:
Kingston Fossil Plant, a 1.4-gigawatt coal-fired power plant located in Roane County, just outside Kingston, Tennessee on the shore of Watts Bar Lake. | Photo: Getty Images	

The Trump administration...

more.title: Amazon blames human employees for an AI coding agent’s mistake
more.description: Amazon Web Services suffered a 13-hour outage to one system in December as a result of its AI coding assistant Kiro's actions, according to the Financial Times. Numerous unnamed Amazon employees told...

more.title: Japanese tech giant Advantest hit by ransomware attack
more.description: Advantest Corporation disclosed that its corporate network has been targeted in a ransomware attack that may have affected customer or employee data. [...]

more.title: India’s Sarvam launches Indus AI chat app as competition heats up
more.description: Sarvam's Indus chat app is currently available in beta.

more.title: The creator economy’s ad revenue problem and India’s AI ambitions
more.description: The creator economy is evolving fast, and ad revenue alone isn’t cutting it anymore. YouTubers are launching product lines, acquiring startups, and building actual business empires. In fact, MrBeast’s...

more.title: InScope nabs $14.5M to solve the pain of financial reporting
more.description: The startup, founded by accountants who worked at Flexport, Miro, Hopin and Thrive Global, automates the difficulties of prepping financial statements.

more.title: Great news for xAI: Grok is now pretty good at answering questions about Baldur’s Gate
more.description: A new report from Business Insider reveals that high-level engineers at xAI were pulled off other projects to make sure Grok could answer detailed questions about the video game Baldur's Gate.

more.title: ‘Toy Story 5’ takes aim at creepy AI toys: ‘I’m always listening’
more.description: Addictive, AI-enabled tablets are taking over, and also, Woody is balding in the new Toy Story movie, out June 19.

more.title: Defense Department and Anthropic Square Off in Dispute Over A.I. Safety
more.description: How artificial intelligence will be used in future battlefields is an issue that has turned increasingly political and may put Anthropic in a bind.

more.title: Meta Begins $65 Million Election Push to Advance A.I. Agenda
more.description: Meta’s biggest election investment aims to prevent state legislation that it fears could inhibit artificial intelligence development. Its spending starts this week in Texas and Illinois.

more.title: FBI: Over $20 million stolen in surge of ATM malware attacks in 2025
more.description: The FBI warned that Americans lost more than $20 million last year amid a massive surge in ATM "jackpotting" attacks, in which criminals use malware to force cash machines to dispense money. [...]

more.title: Attackers Use New Tool to Scan for React2Shell Exposure
more.description: Researchers say threat actors wielded the sophisticated — and unfortunately named — toolkit to target high-value networks for React2Shell exploitation.

more.title: In Other News: Ransomware Shuts US Clinics, ICS Vulnerability Surge, European Parliament Bans AI
more.description:
Other noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Axonius lays off employees, Abu Dhabi conference data leak, HackerOne addresses AI concerns.
The post In Other News: Ransomware Shuts...

more.title: Scam Abuses Gemini Chatbots to Convince People to Buy Fake Crypto
more.description: A convincing presale site for phony "Google Coin" features an AI assistant that engages victims with a slick sales pitch, funneling payment to attackers.

more.title: [Virtual Event] Shields Up: Key Technologies Reshaping Cybersecurity Defenses
Urgent research needed to tackle AI threats, says Google AI boss
more.description: But the head of the US delegation at the AI Impact Summit in Delhi says: "We totally reject global governance of AI."

more.title: Microsoft error sees confidential emails exposed to AI tool Copilot
more.description: The company says it has addressed the issue and it "did not provide anyone access to information they weren't already authorised to see".

more.title: Asos co-founder dies after Thailand apartment block fall
more.description: Quentin Griffiths co-founded Asos in 2000 and remained a significant shareholder after leaving the firm five years later.

more.title: Starmer 'appeasing' big tech firms, says online safety campaigner
more.description: Baroness Kidron tells the BBC the PM has being "late to the party" in regulating social media.

more.title: Nasa boss says Boeing Starliner failure one of worst in its history
more.description: The agency released a critical report that puts the Starliner incident at same mistake level assigned to the fatal Columbia and Challenger shuttle disasters.

more.title: The Chinese AI app sending Hollywood into a panic
more.description: Clips of Deadpool and other film characters have sparked alarm within Hollywood over copyright infringement.

more.title: A.I. Isn’t Coming for Every White-Collar Job. At Least Not Yet.
more.description: Tech workers are increasingly worried that the artificial intelligence they are building will replace them. But some are optimistic that it is just one more tool to work with.

more.title: West Virginia Sues Apple, Claiming It Allows Sharing of Child Sexual Abuse Material
more.description: The state’s attorney general said in a lawsuit filed on Thursday that the company declined to use tools that recognize the material stored on iCloud.

more.title: Money no longer matters to AI’s top talent
more.description:
Today on Decoder we’re going to talk about the war for AI talent. Right now, the hottest job market on the planet is for AI researchers.
The vast majority of these people are concentrated into a small...

more.title: Nigerian man gets eight years in prison for hacking tax firms
more.description: A Nigerian national was sentenced to eight years in prison for hacking multiple tax preparation firms in Massachusetts and filing fraudulent tax returns seeking over $8.1 million in refunds. [...]

more.title: Latin America's Cyber Maturity Lags Threat Landscape
more.description: The slower pace of upgrades has the unintended impact of creating a haven for attackers, especially for initial access brokers and ransomware gangs.

more.title: Emerging Chiplet Designs Spark Fresh Cybersecurity Challenges
more.description: As scaled-down circuits with limited functions redefine computing for AI systems and autonomous vehicles, their flexibility demands new approaches to safeguard critical infrastructure.

more.title: Supply Chain Attack Secretly Installs OpenClaw for Cline Users
more.description: The malicious version of Cline's npm package — 2.3.0 — was downloaded more than 4,000 times before it was removed.

more.title: Best-in-Class 'Starkiller' Phishing Kit Bypasses MFA
more.description: A user-friendly PhaaS tool beats standard methods for detecting phishing attacks by live-proxying legitimate login sites.

more.title: Abu Dhabi Finance Week Exposed VIP Passport Details
more.description: Unprotected cloud data sends the wrong signal at a time when the emirate's trying to attract investors and establish itself as a global financial center.

more.title: Why the shift left dream has become a nightmare for security and developers
more.description: The "shift left" approach has increased pressure on developers, as speed demands override security checks in modern CI pipelines. Qualys explains how analyzing 34,000 public container images revealed...

more.title: PayPal discloses data breach that exposed user info for 6 months
more.description: PayPal is notifying customers of a data breach after a software error in a loan application exposed their sensitive personal information, including Social Security numbers, for nearly 6 months last ye...

more.title: Mississippi medical center closes all clinics after ransomware attack
more.description: The University of Mississippi Medical Center (UMMC) closed all its clinic locations statewide on Thursday following a ransomware attack. [...]

more.title: Ukrainian gets 5 years for helping North Koreans infiltrate US firms
more.description: A Ukrainian national was sentenced to five years in prison for providing North Korean IT workers with stolen identities that helped them infiltrate U.S. companies. [...]

more.title: Flaw in Grandstream VoIP phones allows stealthy eavesdropping
more.description: A critical vulnerability in Grandstream GXP1600 series VoIP phones allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to gain root privileges and silently eavesdrop on communications. [...]

more.title: Google blocked over 1.75 million Play Store app submissions in 2025
more.description: Google says that through 2025, it blocked more than 255,000 Android apps from obtaining excessive access to sensitive user data and rejected over 1.75 million apps from being published on Google Play...

more.title: AI’s promise to indie filmmakers: Faster, cheaper, lonelier
more.description: AI expands access to filmmaking for resource-constrained creators. But as efficiency becomes the industry’s north star, creativity risks being overwhelmed by a deluge of low-effort, AI-generated conte...

more.title: Peak XV raises $1.3B, doubles down on AI as global VC rivalry in India heats up
more.description: Peak XV says most of its new capital will target India as the firm prioritizes AI, fintech and cross-border bets while navigating recent partner departures.

more.title: Why these startup CEOs don’t think AI will replace human roles
more.description: The CEOs of Read AI and Lucidya told TechCrunch at Web Summit Qatar that they see AI tools replacing tasks, rather than workers.

more.title: YouTube’s latest experiment brings its conversational AI tool to TVs
more.description: YouTube is testing conversational AI on smart TVs, allowing viewers to ask the assistant questions related to the video they're watching on the big screen.

more.title: FBI: $20 Million Losses Caused by 700 ATM Jackpotting Attacks in 2025
more.description:
The FBI has confirmed that the Ploutus malware, which has been around for over a decade, is still being used in the wild.
The post FBI: $20 Million Losses Caused by 700 ATM Jackpotting Attacks in 2025...

more.title: Chip Testing Giant Advantest Hit by Ransomware
more.description:
The company is investigating whether any customer or employee data was stolen by hackers.
The post Chip Testing Giant Advantest Hit by Ransomware appeared first on SecurityWeek.

more.title: 7 days until ticket prices rise for TechCrunch Disrupt 2026
more.description: Lowest ticket prices to TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 end February 27. Up to $680 off individual passes and up to 30% off group passes. Register before they go up to join 10,000 founders, tech operators, an...

more.title: Dell's Hard-Coded Flaw: A Nation-State Goldmine
more.description: A China-related attacker has exploited the vendor flaw since mid-2024, allowing it to move laterally, maintain persistent access, and deploy malware.

more.title: Why creators are ditching ad revenue for chocolate bars and fintech acquisitions
more.description: The creator economy is evolving fast, and ad revenue alone isn’t cutting it anymore. YouTubers are launching product lines, acquiring startups, and building actual business empires. In fact, MrBeast’s...

more.title: Zuckerberg defends Meta in landmark social media addiction trial
more.description: The billionaire boss said he "always" regretted not making faster progress to identify users under 13.

more.title: Decoding the A.I. Beliefs of Anthropic and Its C.E.O., Dario Amodei
more.description: The company is at odds with the Pentagon over how its A.I. will be used. The conflict has its roots in the foundational plan for Anthropic.

more.title: Mark Zuckerberg Takes the Stand in Social Media Addiction Trial
more.description: Meta’s chief executive said users spent a lot of time on Instagram because of its value, as he was grilled about child safety issues in front of a jury.

more.title: CISA orders feds to patch actively exploited Dell flaw within 3 days
more.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) ordered government agencies to patch their systems within three days against a maximum-severity Dell vulnerability that has been under...

more.title: More Than 40% of South Africans Were Scammed in 2025
more.description: Survey underscores the reality that scammers follow "scalable opportunities and low friction," rather than rich targets that tend to be better protected.

more.title: Critical Grandstream VoIP Bug Highlights SMB Security Blind Spot
more.description: CVE-2026-2329 allows unauthenticated root-level access to SMB phone infrastructure, so attackers can intercept calls, commit toll fraud, and impersonate users.

more.title: A CISO's Playbook for Defending Data Assets Against AI Scraping
more.description: Discover a strategic approach to govern scraping risks, balance security with business growth, and safeguard intellectual capital from automated data harvesting.

more.title: How do you modernise mango farming?
more.description: India's mango farmers are being urged to innovate as climate change makes cultivation "unpredictable".

more.title: His Team Devised Ways to Keep World Cup Crowds Safe
more.description: Michael Silevitch leads a research center dedicated to protecting busy public spaces. Last April, he was instructed to “end all work” immediately.

more.title: The speech police came for Colbert
more.description: Generally speaking, arcane and mostly unenforced FCC rules are not the province of late night talk shows. FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr seems intent on changing that, though; not long after causing a...

more.title: How infostealers turn stolen credentials into real identities
more.description: Infostealer dumps increasingly tie stolen credentials to real identities, linking usernames, cookies, and behavior across personal and enterprise accounts. Specops explains how analyzing 90,000 dumps...

more.title: Nearly 1 Million User Records Compromised in Figure Data Breach
more.description:
The blockchain-based lender has confirmed a data breach after ShinyHunters leaked over 2GB of data allegedly stolen from the company.
The post Nearly 1 Million User Records Compromised in Figure Data...

more.title: Venice Security Emerges From Stealth With $33M Funding for Privileged Access Management
more.description:
Formerly named Valkyrie, the company’s funding includes $25 million raised in a Series A round. 
The post Venice Security Emerges From Stealth With $33M Funding for Privileged Access Management appear...

more.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 Super Early Bird rates end in 1 week
more.description: The lowest ticket rates of the year for TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 end next Friday, February 27. Save up to $680 on your pass. Register now before prices increase.

more.title: UAE’s G42 teams up with Cerebras to deploy 8 exaflops of compute in India
more.description: Abu Dhabi-based tech company G42 has partnered with U.S.-based chipmaker Cerebras to deploy 8 exaflops of compute through a new system in India.

more.title: General Catalyst commits $5B to India over five years
more.description: The pledge marks a sharp jump from General Catalyst's earlier $500 million–$1 billion India earmark.

more.title: NIST’s Quantum Breakthrough: Single Photons Produced on a Chip
more.description:
NIST’s single photon chip will likely make QKD an option for a wider range of companies. 
The post NIST’s Quantum Breakthrough: Single Photons Produced on a Chip appeared first on SecurityWeek.

more.title: SpaceX rocket fireball linked to plume of polluting lithium
more.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 crashed to Earth last year. Now scientists have measured the pollution it caused.

more.title: Tech firms will have 48 hours to remove abusive images under new law
more.description: The government is proposing that intimate image abuse should be treated more severely.

more.title: What Do A.I. Chatbots Discuss Among Themselves? We Sent One to Find Out.
more.description: We interviewed our bot about what it learned on Moltbook, the A.I.-only social network.

more.title: Connected and Compromised: When IoT Devices Turn Into Threats
more.description: Reused passwords, a lack of network segmentation, and poor sanitization processes make the Internet of Things' attack surfaces more dangerous.

more.title: Threat Intelligence Has a Human-Shaped Blind Spot
more.description: How I realized what I was taught to about threat intelligence was missing something crucial.

more.title: It’s MAGA v Broligarch in the battle over prediction markets
more.description: The Polymarket website hosts trading on whether Houthi militias would strike Israeli territory arranged on a laptop computer in Forest Hills neighborhood in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Sund...

more.title: French Government Says 1.2 Million Bank Accounts Exposed in Breach
more.description:
The Ministry of Economy reported discovering unauthorized access to the national bank account registry FICOBA.
The post French Government Says 1.2 Million Bank Accounts Exposed in Breach appeared firs...
